column10: fun game

[OUTDATED- WILL MAKE NEW UNDER FULL RELEASE]

Its been over a year of early access..

We have only received 2 major updates overall, in a span of a year, the updates being Snowball Bluffs and the recent Come Rain Or Slime. I was expecting more from Monomi due to the first game.

Overall we have received a major graphics overhaul, making the game pleasant to look at, few features not from the base game (weather system, not really improved resource gathering system and upgrades system) and a couple of new slimes. But thats it.

There is basically barely any communication between the Monomi Park team and their community on updates and road-maps. I understand that they are trying to not leak anything until they are sure that it will be added but atleast give us SOME idea that they are working on something to make the fanbase happy.

As for now, the price is not worth for what this game offers so get it if there is a sale at some point.

Pickup up slime rancher 1 in the meantime.

Got the charm of the first game, but the soundtrack seriously fell off. Compared to the soundtrack of the first game, this sequel has barely any instrumental variation. Nearly every track is played by piano and percussion and not much else. Secondly, most of the tracks do not have their own signature melody that the tracks from Slime Rancher 1 had. The lack-luster, barely existing rhythms of each track do not stand out from each other at all; pretty much all of them follow the same pattern of having a repetitive rhythm that essentially are all either triplets or 16th notes played over and over. With these two things combined, it results in the music from all the areas sounding nearly indistinguishable. 

I'm not even sure if this soundtrack is even composed by the same person because I seriously listen to the entirety of Slime Rancher 1 OST on a weekly basis because it is truly unique. For example, the glass desert theme conveyed the sound glass with perfection and the heat of the desert still comes through the accompaniment in the back. I'm very disappointed that the Slime Rancher 2 OST is not even CLOSE to being on par in quality as its predecessor. 

This game doesn't stand out quite enough from the first--especially in the soundtrack--for me to justify recommending it; just get the first game. Been loving that thing since 2018 and it still holds up perfectly to this day.

It is early access which definitely means it can make a big turn around to make it better but having the sequel also be early access is something, not lazy because this is still a real game and probably better than most of the corporate slop out there, but still, dang </3

I wouldn't recommend buying this game. It's very good quality, and the new additions are pretty cool, but its way too similar to the original. From what I've seen, the updates are almost yearly, and only adding a few new features and doing bug fixes. Slime Ranchers charm was the cute Slimes and the fun gameplay, that was the reason it became so popular. Slime Rancher 2 is more like an update for the original game. Slime Rancher 2 is 10 dollars more than the original, which wouldn't seem like much, but for a game that is essentially a DLC, it's pretty expensive. If you want a few new slimes and a bit of new gameplay, then maybe get this game, but if you're just looking for this genre, get the original and pay less. But in the end, it's all up to you whether you want the game or not, i'm just a reviewer.

15 hrs for my first review, 217 hours for the second half.

Idk what to put here, I really liked the first game and this game is also really fun and cute and charming. SO. Yeah :)

Edit: Months later, and a considerable increase in hours played, I still highly highly recommend this game. Especially if you liked the first game! As of this edit (Feb.20th.2024) the game is still early access. The story won't be finished until the full release and ever ea title is going to have it's bugs. But they're quick to work on bugs and the community is good with helping troubleshoot from my experience.
The biggest draw back it seems for most folks, especially those who have played the first game, is that the game isn't complete yet. Meaning they crave the story and drones and more automation to their ranches. So if you're more for exploration and speed grinding for drones to spend *more* time away from your ranch you might not get as much out of this game. 
That being said, buying it now won't require buying it a second time for the full release. So I still highly recommend this game if it looks your thing.

I'd honestly probably rate this game somewhere between Yes and No atm were it an option, But considering I thoroughly enjoyed SR1, I'll settle for this. TLDR Is you should probably wait. I trust the Devs will polish it up in time.

The sequel really is just more of what we got in the first game, for better and worse. There really isn't anything unique about the game yet to give it it's own identity separate from the first one. That being said the gameplay loop in SR1 was the biggest draw for me and having more of that isn't something to sniff at, but YMMV compared to mine.

The 2 biggest things  that make me hesitant to outright recommend it right now though is.
1) Updates for this game have been SLOW. I bought this game over a year ago and in that time, only one update has been released. It was an update reworking a major part of the game, But for something in early access it is definitely disheartening.

2) Is the biggie though, The lack of new gadgets and slime science stuff to play around with at the moment but especially Drones. They're going to be coming later in development with improvements from SR1, but the lack of Drones makes it very hard to actually explore the game world whilst still maintaining your ranch without having to constantly run back every 10 minutes lest your ranch fall into disrepair. There aren't a whole lot of new toys to draw attention away from this right now either, most of the new gadgets and buildings are just simple cosmetics. They're nice, but they feel more like a late game focus rather than something to spend time on so early on.

Honestly, give it some time and pick it up once there's more meat here. I trust the devs will eventually get to that point and the game is gonna be a fun timesink when we get to that point, but sadly it isn't there yet.

The game continues to bring calm and fun to every gaming session. It's come a long way since I first tried it years ago. I find it disappointing that there are no achievements to earn on Steam. The enjoyment of playing the game is enough for now.

[Opening]
|
| - As of 2/18/2024 (mm/dd/yyyy), I have 260.1 hours in Slime Rancher 1 on my Steam copy.
| - Add an extra 100~ or so hours from when I used to play it on my Xbox!
| - I even have some of the official(?) plushies!
| - Heck, a younger me even convinced my parents to name one of our cats Hunter!
| - ...A younger me also suggested the name of "Beatrix" for my little sister. It didn't get far.
| - That last one was NOT my proudest moment. I was like 9, cut me some slack.
| - Obviously, I love Slime Rancher quite a lot, so I figured I'd voice some of my opinions.
| - This is meant to be constructive. I want this game to turn out as good as possible.
|
\___________________________]

- + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + -
I can't really come to a real conclusion on Slime Rancher 2 as of currently, as the game is in Early Access. As of now, I would recommended buying and playing Slime Rancher 1 over Slime Rancher 2, as Slime Rancher 1 simply has more content (afaik) and it's generally a good idea to start with the first game in a series.

This does not mean Slime Rancher 2 is a bad game.
It's quite promising if anything, but it's a tiny bit lacking as of currently in my opinion.
And of course it's going to be! It's in Early Access!
Please note that as of currently I've only experienced v0.3.0 when I say that it's a tiny bit lacking, though.
- + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + - + = + -

[Now, for the changes I like, and the changes I DON'T like.]
|
[The Good S%$#]
|
| - The game looks damn beautiful!
| - Introduces new cool stuff relating to environments! (like those geysers! ...they're new right)
| - The weather system adds a fun little bit of immersion, along with gameplay change-ups.
| - The new slimes look really cool!
| - WHAT. YOU CAN PLACE STUFF ANYWHERE NOW?!
| - The new GUI f#$@ing rocks!
| - What's that? Actual gameplay needed to get lab resources? That's an improvement.
| - A lotta other stuff which I have forgotten about since I have horrible memory.
|
\______________]
/
|
[The... Not So Good S&!#]
|
| - Just kind of feels like a slightly more empty SR1, although it is in Early Access to be fair.
| - The game is a bit grindy like SR1, but amplified a bit since there's less to do right now.
| - Who's idea was it to make certain slimes only spawn during certain weather conditions?!
| - Same goes for resources. It took me like, an hour to get TWO Drift Crystals! TWO!
| - On the topic of weather, I think that cyclones should be able to lift the player better.
| - Again, a lotta other stuff which I have forgotten about.
|
\______________]
/
|
[Final-ish Verdict]-[2/19/2024]-[v0.4.0]
|
| - Do I recommend SR2? For sure! But check out SR1 first and complete that beforehand.
| - Wouldn't blame you for waiting to buy, but it's definitely shaping up to be a good sequel.
| - I'll be sure to update this review over time. If I remember to ever, obviously.
|
\______________]

I love it. It is so creative and I've been playing the 1st one forever. There is so much to do. My personal top favorites.

The Gadgets patch made the game a little better, offered something more to do, but sadly the ranching aspect of the game is still not good, and far short of Slime Rancher 1. 

We are short on corrals, we have only gotten 1 new slime since launch and drones are sorely needed because the gameplay loop is too stressful. There is still nothing to spend money on, so I no longer have a reason to collect plorts, the main goal in the game. 

The ranching aspect seems to lack innovation and so far it's a lesser version from the original games. This game seems to be exploration heavy, but I feel tied down to my farm with a ball and chain, everything goes to hell too quickly. 

I do have hope that the devs will include better content, so I will keep my recommendation as a no for now, but will probably change that to a yes at launch if things improve. So, save your money and wait for launch.

They've hit it out of the park again! The game is fun, adorable, and genuinely well made. Throw some slimes in a corral, put some food in the auto-feeder and go explore! :D

Though, please do remember the game is in EARLY ACCESS, so things will be unfinished and in the process of being worked on. The game does not have an ending yet, so feel free to put the game down and play other things while you wait for updates. Your slimes aren't going anywhere. ('u')


Ignore most of the negative reviews, they're made by people that don't read patch notes or dev communications, dont realize this is an EARLY ACCESS title that is currently being worked on, or just believe random rumors and blame the devs when those rumors turn out to be false. A lot of "players" also complain about a "lack of automation" that frankly isn't needed. A fully filled auto-feeder will last for *THREE* ingame days if set to slow, so I HIGHLY doubt they're using them either correctly or at all. As for the "Lack of communication from the devs", the devs clearly communicate through the patch notes and dev logs when to expect things, but a lot of commentators and reviewers don't read them and then whine when they don't get what was never promised. Some "reviews" say they "removed things from SR1", and those things they mention never existed in the first game at all.

This game is absolutely delightful. Much like the first Slime Rancher game, it is pure serotonin. I actually think Monomi Park knocked it outta the park (pun completely intended) with this one. Monomi Park is an amazing studio that deserves all the love for their amazing work.

Most of the times I do not even notice that this is an early acces game. The new slime designs are cute and a lot of systems have been reworked from the first game. Very good and enjoyable, but it certainly has a problem as of current in the beta, 
I have 3 primary problems with the current beta (4.0) the game has a very fun environment and new slimes are always welcome, however 
1: the game feels a little aimless in the sense that comparing my experience with slime rancher 1 and 2 i felt like i always had a thing to do for obvious progression such as "there's a slime door and i don't have a key but know where a gordo is" this for me made it feel like i was on track additionally i found in the second game i was able to climb thing i wasn't meant to and get to places i shouldn't be extremely easy, even before i had the jet pack. 
2 currently there are no drones and being in end game is hell. everything needs food and i want to explore but also don't want my slimes going hungry. i also find that currently money feels kinda worthless. i mean beyond the core upgrades and the buildings i feel as though there is nothing to buy which means i just accumulate money. (currently have $95,000 gold and have no idea what to do with it.) Without any automation it means you must spend days on the farm and just when you finished the last task... The first one is ready to do again.
3 Whilst the warm welcome of new slimes and my personal favourite of the ringtail slime, it came at an unfortunate cost of previous slimes. The Quantum Slime, Rad Slime, and Mosaic Slime are no where to be found as of current. (additionally all of the special smiles: Quicksilver Slime, Glitch Slime, Party Gordo,	Twinkle Slime are also not included but these slimes are less significant. sorry anyone who likes these)
 My final thoughts are still that this game is amazing and has major potential for the future. even right now, without the inclusion of drones this game is worth its money.
Thanks for reading :D

This game is perfect for a relaxing session of cutesy gaming and even though in early access, is much improved on the first game. The game looks fantastic and I can't wait to see if any new areas are coming out. A frosty-looking area would be cool, with a similar slime to go with it. The gadgets are great too, the energy pad being great for running around the ranch without losing stamina and being able to have market and refinery depositors around the ranch and the world makes the game pacing so much better. I would seriously recommend this game to anyone, I'm not a fan of exploration games but this one is one of the exceptions. Keep up the good work!

Some things I'd like to see in future updates:
- The delivery system to NPCs that the first game had. It would be a good way to unlock blueprints and decorations and something to do while waiting for plants to grow or chicken coops to fill.
- Some more things to buy like blueprints, shortcuts, resource nodes or colours for your vacpack or house.
- A mini-map would be a godsent, even if it was an unlockable blueprint.
- It would be a great QOL change if you could rotate corrals, farms and coops so the food dispenser and plort collectors could be in more convenient positions.

This game has taken everything from Slime Rancher (the original) and added a MASSIVE map and more slime's to take care of with amazing graphics, I would recommend this game to anyone if your new to Slime Rancher and haven't played the original or if you've come from the original Slime Rancher!

i fundamentally disagree with this products existence as there's no significant change from slime rancher 1, play that instead as it features the core gameplay that drove people to want this game. as for this sequel, I have literally zero interest in the steven universe protagonist they introduced nearing the end of the original slime ranchers development, nor the strangely generic yet alienating story they introduced alongside her, as it has zero bearing on anything the game actually represents, if you're bored of SR1, get this I guess, but don't expect much.

Obviously the game is still in early release, so there is plenty of room for improvement in terms of story and adding more areas/slimes/resources, but the graphics are beautiful, the slimes are cute, and there's a ton of fun in just exploring the world that presently exists. I'm excited to see where the team takes it from here and to be in on the ground floor (so to speak) of a new chapter in the story of Slime Rancher.

Much like the first game, this is a lovely and pleasant farm sim where you collect and maintain cute adorable slimes. The number of combinations you can make to give you maximum plort payout is limited only by imagination, and you can't three-way hybrids. The gorgeous visuals and gentle music will have you swept up in the world, time will slip away while you're having fun. Though if you are hunting for the Yolky Slime, yeah, you might get frustrated with this slime's random spawning at Hen nests and going to every zone to check if it spawns (it took nearly 8 hours of hunting to finally get one to appear...pain is real and it looks like a sunny-side up egg...I have 3 now in 39 hours of playtime). The lore continues to be interesting and emotional. Writing this as of patch 0.3.0...I look forward to more and the full release. What wonders await me as the game continues to build? I can only play and enjoy as things come. Till then, however, I shall continue to farm and raise my slime babies. See you on the ranch.  ^_^
Fun game, good for relaxing gameplay.

I got around 130 hours on the first Slime rancher and around 60 on Slime rancher two as of now- 
Unless you're painstakingly obsessed with the entire story and aesthetic that Slime Rancher as a whole offers I wouldn't recommend this game. 



Pros! (DISCLAIMER! HALF IF NOT MOST OF THE BIGGER FEATURES WERE ADDED IN ALMOST 2 YEARS POST OF ITS LAUNCH!) 
* The Graphics are unreal compared to the first game! They're breath taking!  
* Building System: In the first game you had to find pre-placed points where you could place down utilities- But as of the Eighth of February 2024 Slime Rancher 2 has changed their entire fundamentals of buildings! you can place shit anywhere! 
* Brand New map with little bits of lore and story sprinkled here and there! 
* New lore/story progression system! (removed the letters you'd received in the first game which I won't go into due to spoilers but it is definitely more engaging) 
* Weather system! They've added a weather system which is fundamental towards finding certain slimes as well as make the game far more immersive and visually appealing! 
* Like 5 new slimes! 
* Changed how you get resources! 
--------------------------------------------------------
That's all the "noticeable" improvements I've found personally. 
Now let me go onto the cons. 
--------------------------------------------------------

Cons! 
* After almost  two years in the waiting the lore/story of the game can all be found/completed in about 1-2 hours! (my personal experience) and after that you better get good at entertaining yourself! 
* They have removed a pretty sizable chunk of the slimes from the original game. They took out A LOT of slimes that were originally in the first game but to their credit they have added I believe 3 slimes back from which they've removed- which is something I guess after waiting for one and a half years? (Saber slime, Tangle Slime, Dervish Slime.) 
* Gadgets! Until The Eighth of February 2024 there were almost no actual gadgets! Like nothing besides portals and some that would send everything back to the refinery!  yet again to their credit they did change a major part of getting resources so the need for pumps etc. have really died down but really I feel like they just didn't put enough thought into the whole gadget system prior to the most recent update as of writing this review (which not to complain and sound ungrateful for but almost 2 years in the waiting REALLY just showed me how barren everything was. (which for a full price game in early access I WILL COMPLAIN ABOUT!)) 
-----------------------------------------

To wrap things up I'd just say "If you want to play slime rancher buy the first game- only get the second if you're utterly addicted and depraved for slime rancher content (just as I am)

So, as for now, this game is a letdown. 
The full price is completely uncalled for, so better grab it on sale if you really want to try it out. I've got it for around 17€ and I'm still experiencing buyer's remorse. There is an upgrade compared to the first Slime Rancher but definitely not enough to spend money on. I should've read more about it and will probably be more careful about my purchases from now on, even on licences I used to liking. 

• Out of 21 slimes, 14 COME FROM THE FIRST ONE. 2/3 of the main aspect of the game is the same as the first game they made. Tarr and feral are still the only ennemies and nothing has changed for them neither.

• You get messages every day or so, yet, no quests like the first. It's just talking and talking just to give you customisation for the exterior of the Ranch or gadgets to help you tp around the place or fight tarrs. No toys for the Slimes either, which I find disappointing.

• The progression is fucked up. Around day 7 in-game I already had so much money I didn't even know what to do with it anymore. There is no challenge around this aspect and so, the satisfaction of building your Ranch is fast to disappear. This is a shame since the materials needed to upgrade your gear actually is a bit balanced because you have to roam around the map to collect them (if you don't put teleporters everywhere that is).

• I've played 17 in-game days so far and I've been bored since 4-5 of them. All in all, I've maybe played around 10 to 12h (I've let the game running while eating a lot, enhance the 17h played) and it feels like I've reached the end already. I've played for less than a week. 

Eventhough I was very pleased at first and felt the same glee I experienced while playing the first one, you feel like you've thrown your money out the window pretty quickly. I hope the devs will put a lot of work in it and implement at least a bunch of new slimes into the game because right now, it just feels like a polished copy and past. I wish I could get a refund. 
This also is just me, but the twitter post about hiring is also not reassuring imo.

TL;DR: Game is already really good with minimal bugs, great new world, exploration, and Slime Science system. But a couple of problems and currently feels more like a Slime Rancher 1.5 or Slime Rancher DLC. Moving more and more into a full, new game. Still highly recommended.

—————————
Gadgets My Way, v0.4.0! What an update. Entirely revamped gadget system, allowing them to be placed nearly everywhere. Revamped fabricator UI and blueprints tab in the Slimepedia, allowing you to see the resources required for a decoration or gadget. There's also new areas to explore within each area, and with that comes new treasure pods with the new gadgets showcased in the trailer! They were relatively easy to find, but not placed out in the open, which is good. Apart from that, new resources (Storm Glass, Lightning Mote and Drift Crystal) for the new gadgets, and there's some QoL additions like the new comms notification when someone contacts you at the conservatory. Pretty great update, and I can't wait for another major expansion!
—————————

My experience with this game has been amazing. I played a lot of Slime Rancher 1 across multiple platforms, so I was thrilled for this release. The new areas are amazing, with brand new nooks and crannies to explore, with each area being distinct with its colourful and playful nature. The soundtrack is once again phenomenal, although deciding to be more chill than Slime Rancher 1. (The night tracks are still the best ones in the game, in every area.)

The new Slime Science system is AMAZING. Once you upgrade your vacpack with the extractor, YOU are the apiary. YOU are the drill. YOU are the pump. I think you get the point. You find resources around the island and can vac them up instead of placing drills down in each area and waiting for their cycle to finish. It's a very polished system for being one of the biggest new features and I cannot wait to see it get expanded on.

Slime Rancher 2 does a great job with exploration too. The map is already massive, and as stated previously, each area is distinct and recognisable. Slime Keys are a thing of the past, in favour of you bursting gordos to find twisty things to activate portals, or the gordo sitting directly on top of the portal, and I think they've done it wonderfully. I'm very excited for what Monomi Park has to offer with the areas they're planning to add. 

Starmail has been replaced with a little wireless communication box in front of The Conservatory, pretty neat. Nothing has been heard from Casey so far though :(

No need for the section on v0.1.1 and v0.1.2, as everything since then (bug fixes and QoL improvements) has been improved on. I've ran into even less bugs in later updates, but some areas are definitely still too bright. Definitely going to try and keep this review updated with each update, though.

However, Tarrs are still a MASSIVE problem naturally, and I find the game more fun with them disabled at this point.

Old update, but welcome in v0.2.0, the Song of the Sabers update! With it comes a brand new island, Powderball Puffs, and many new items and a couple of slimes. They've also added 4 new treasure pods to Ember Valley and Starlight Strand. 

In Powderball Puffs, you can find the returning star of the update; the Saber slime. In this winter wonderland you'll also find a Saber gordo and normal slimes such as Rock, Boom, etc. Powderball Puff's real party trick is at night, when its "Auroral Anomalies" show up, revealing secret pathways and other really cool things. There's also the new Thundercluck chicken, with a new secret slime, the Yolky Slime, which is an elusive and rare slime found around chicken nests. Another elusive and rare thing is Sun Sap.

With all the new content in the update, I'm very happy with it. It is starting to feel like how Slime Rancher 1 felt in early access. Everything in this update is great, my only gripe is how rare the Yolky Slime and Sun Sap is. This game is finally culminating into something new. See you next update!

Small little update, v0.3.0, "Come Rain or Slime". Adds back old favourites, like the Dervish and Tangle Slimes, with Prickly Pears, and a whole new dynamic weather system. The update is alright, but 9 months for this seems a bit... underwhelming. Would love to see a bit more in future content updates.

For now, Slime Rancher 2 STILL feels more like a Slime Rancher 1.5, or Slime Rancher 1 DLC, but with more content updates it is finally feeling like something new, definitely getting there. I'm optimistic about the future of Slime Rancher 2 though, considering how far Slime Rancher 1 came within its time. But for now, be brave, be bold, and stay wiggly. Have fun on Rainbow Island!

(THE ISSUE WAS RANDOMLY FIXED FOR ME HERE, BUT IT AFFECTS PEOPLE RANDOMLY IT SEEMS AND I DONT KNOW WHETHER OR NOT I CAN RECOMMEND IT IN GOOD FAITH KNOWING THAT. PLEASE CONSIDER READING THIS WHOLE REVIEW OR SKIMMING OVER IT)

okay, look, I'm going to be very honest here.
the game is great. its cute, its pretty and I (personally) find it fun. it's incomplete as of writing this, yes, and gets a bit boring after a while, but I can understand that coding something like this takes a lot of time. the fact it feels more like a DLC isn't even my main problem. I would absolutely recommend this game if it weren't for one thing. I myself and a lot of other people that I have seen all had one issue that happened out of nowhere, that being that when you get to the screen that reads 'press any key to begin' the game crashes. its important to note that for me (and a lot of other people) there was no issue like this before, we had enough storage and everything functioned just fine. it's also worth noting that one of the devs in the 'support' section of the game's page here on steam keeps replying to these reports with the same thing: a link to a discussion trying to detail how to fix this issue. my problem is that every time, it's the graphics card that's blamed by the devs which both me and some other people close to me think of as silly because usually it's just one type of card that doesn't work but the amount of people having this issue would suggest we have different cards. another thing I've noticed is that on one of these boards asking about the bug, after the dev responded with the link, more people came forth about it and then the discussion was locked, making it impossible to respond.

I DO NOT BLAME THE DEVS FOR THIS, though it is a bit shady. I can only hope something is done to fix it.
I could of course be wrong, and it really could be an issue with my pc, but please keep in mind that the guide does not work, no matter what I try. IF ANYONE KNOWS HOW TO FIX THIS, PLEASE TELL ME (its why the comments are on)

Graphically speaking this is a great improvement to the first game, it's beautiful.
It has a lot of the slimes from the first game as well as a few new ones, including Saber slimes which you can actually capture now, but it's seriously lacking.

Biggest problem is that for some reason they didn't implement drones for automation from the start, meaning you have no time to explore the world or do anything in general between managing your farms, collecting plorts and keeping your slimes happy and fed.
Until they add drones to automate stuff it is basically unplayable and it's unlikely that we will get them for a while considering the latest update - which added a weather system(cool but not interesting or useful) and two slimes from the first game - took several months to release and there has been very little content besides that.

Early Access isn't an excuse to not have a simple feature from the first game that makes the game playable and enjoyable.

Update 08/02/2024
Latest update added 36 gadgets, which the developers called 'functional. What they actually meant by that is that you can interact with them in some way, but they are not useful. 
Still no drones, still not worth playing.

So it's been.. what, 2 years? Maybe 1. Either way, things are going very slowly, I expected more a lot faster given how Slime Rancher 1 is done and they had a base to work off of, but this is a crawl. See you in like 5 years or something when this game is actually DONE.

I was a big fan of the first Slime Rancher game and this has been a fun continuation so far. It is still Early Access and there are more major updates to be added. It's a very beautiful and fun world to explore and it is designed for you to explore every nook, far off platform, and mountain top. To explore you will need certain gadgets and this is where the slimes come in again. That's right, you will never escape the grip of capitalism. Farm slimes for their plorts for money and resources to fund your exploration efforts. You have a whole new ranch to unlock and new slimes to encounter and several from previous entry.

If there is anything I don't like about the game is that I can't close the map with the map key. I have to use the ESC key... Everything else is tolerable because game isn't complete yet. I sometimes wish there was a "hint" button to temp me when I'm not sure where to look next. Here is a hint for anyone willing to play game: Jump off the side of lots ledges and look back. There is a reason for a gadget that lessens the amount of stuff you lose when you get knocked out.

First of all, I want to say that is is a very good game and I enjoyed every minute I played it. However, this game lacks a lot of content and you run out of things to do extremely quickly.
As such, I can't recommend this game to anyone but know that you won't regret the purchase if you really want to play it.

In about 6 hours I had discovered the entire map. 3 hours later. I had experienced everything the world had to offer, built every gadget, discovered and raised every single slime variant, read all of the drones's messages and became ludicrously rich. 
Heck, the observatory is so big you won't even need to occupy even half of the space given to you to be completely self sufficient.

In the first game, it took me about 20+ hours (though I did take my time) to uncover the entire map and another 5+ hours to complete all side activities. Then to my surprise, the game introduces me to an aftergame area? This was great! Still so much to do in spite of its low price!

This is not the case here. There is no aftergame content whatsoever and I got bored of it extremely quickly but like I said, I had a really fun time the whole way.

In my opinion, they should have added more content to the game before launching it as it feels unfinished. (even if it's still in early access)

Don't go into this, however, expecting a full product!! IT'S BETA, GUYS! MEANING THE ONLY THING OUT RIGHT NOW IS STUFF THAT WAS ALSO IN THE FIRST GAME.
So yes, you may get bored fast. There's a few things here and there that are different, mostly quality of life improvements.
It is very similar to the first game. If you've played the first, you will have no problem jumping in. I will say though, between that and a cheat engine, each major update I've played since purchase, and once I've finished it, I stop playing until the next.

This is prior to them allowing gadgets to be placed ANYWHERE, so maybe once that comes out, it'll hold my attention for more than a few hours.

Still, with all that said, I think it has great potential. I'm really excited to see what new things are coming, as I'm really enjoying the new content. Once the game is fully out, I'll wipe my save and play from the start with no cheats, just to get the full experience. (I've been playing with unlimited Jetpack, and free building, since it is in beta, just to see the early stuff faster.)

It's still a fantastic sequel. It has a lot of potential and some quality of life stuff already included, but I'd LOVE to see more slimes, more gadgets... and a multiplayer. Multiplayer would make this soooo much better imho, but we'll have to wait and see if that's going to be official, or if it'll be a mod.

From what I have played though, I've enjoyed it a lot. I can't wait to see what is in store, because everything so far is just like the original, but better! There's a lot of neat new slimes already, too, so I can't wait to see what NEW slimes will be brought in at a later date.

And add free cosmetics for secrets like the islands from the last game where I would get teleported to a new island where I would get slime-glasses.

Though this game is indeed fun, I would either pick it up in a sale, or wait until it has fully come out

I would like to preface this by saying one thing: If you enjoyed SR1, you will probably enjoy SR2. 

With that out of the way, I would like to warn that the game is truly not in a state to justify it's current price tag. We are over a year in and there have been updates fewer and farther between than the first game. While I am sure the finished product, whenever that ends up being released, is going to be a wonderful experience, I am currently experiencing a lot of buyers remorse and would still opt to play the first game over this by a landslide. It's disheartening that after around 6 months of radio silence, the game got an update consisting of just a weather system, and two slimes from the first game. My trust in the development team is wavering, and I fear it could be several years before the game is at a state where the price justifies the content. Is the game bad? No. Is the game new? Kind of. There are a few new slimes, new areas, but all the gameplay mechanics have yet to be improved upon in any way. The graphics are "prettier," but besides that, it truly just feels like unfinished DLC for the first game rather than it's own identity. 

I'm not ordinarily one to bash small studio games like this, but communication from the team was nonexistent for all of 2023, and I feel the current review ratio does not aptly articulate the state the game is in at the moment. It likely will get better, but if I could go back in time to when I purchased this game, I would absolutely hold off on buying for another two years.

I rarely review, but I've been so disappointed with SR2 that it's warranted in this case. The slimes are the same as SR1, the monetary system is completely off balance (way too hard to get money in the beginning so everything is a slog just to get the bare basics, then it snowballs to the point where you have more than you could possibly spend). It's all the grind of SR1 with none of the discovery, and I'm not tickled like I was the first time, I'm just bored.

Although I would recommend this game, I do have a big gripe. 

Slimes that were in SR1 and arent in SR2:
Quantum, Dervish, Mosaic, Rad, Tangle (very challenging yet rewarding slimes)

Slimes that replaced them:
Flutter, Cotton, Ringtail, Batty, Angler (definitely lamer than the above 5)

The original 5 in my opinion should have been in Slime Rancher 2. They replaced 5 challenging slimes with 5 basic bitch ones. None of the new 5 pose challenges much like the old 5, and in my opinion that is very dissapointing. The whole point of those 5 in Slime Rancher 1 was to pose a challenge to a rancher, while yielding expensive plorts. It made perfect sense. Why would the devs replace these slimes with mush easier, lamer slimes?

But thats just my main gripe. I overall like the game, and I would love to listen to the soundtrack all of the time. It's just one of those things that take off points in my opinion. 

7/10... would be a 10/10 if it still had rad, quantum, mosaic, dervish, and tangle slimes. sorry

I remember buying slime rancher 1 for the first time and being absolutely enthralled, slime rancher 2 did not fail to deliver. A fun exploration game and there's so much more to do! the new slime are adorable and I love the idea of adding weather I am excited to see whats to come in future updates.

 A few points I want to make note of however.
1. this game does not work with older computer models, my laptop could run stuff like resident evil 8 but not this game due to unitys' requirements. It was extremely frustrating. I had to buy a brand new desktop to get it working (i already had plans to buy one but still) 
not only that but my controls like to f*ck up at times and tars lag my game even at the lowest possible setting
2. It can be easy to get tired of the repetitive game play; finding new smiles, farming, and upgrading your equipment. I don't ever find it boring but thought it would be a good point to make. 
3. the rare slimes are a little.. too rare in my opinion, the farming for a yolky can be extremely exhausting, i get the fun of trying to hunt them but gosh i wish the spawn rate were a little better :|

that's all I have to say, I love this game and its a great wind down after my 8 hour shifts at work

Love this game, it's adorable! My personal Largo recommendations:

Batty + Honey
Angler + Pink
Boom + Phosphor
Rock + Tabby
Cotton + Crystal
Saber + Dervish
Ringtail + Hunter
Ringtail + Flutter
Ringtail + Tangle

ESPECIALLY the Ringtail Hunters. I keep those ones in the cave part of the ranch, along with the Angler Pinks, Boom Phosphors, and Batty Honeys. If you're going to have the Hunter largos in the cave, I would also suggest keeping your Flutters in there, so when you feed them, the aura bursts they release will calm them down if the Hunters are agitated and/or feral.

The Slime Rancher games are an absolute treat.
I'm around "The Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything" years old, I'm riddled with anxiety, I'm on the spectrum, and I'm fighting high blood pressure...
When my anxiety is acting up, causing me to go into meltdown mode, and causing my BP to spike, let me tell you: I can boot up the game and leave it at the main menu and just the music helps calm me...
Playing the games relaxes me completely, helps me melt into my chair, and helps me forget whatever triggered my anxiety for awhile, as I enjoy this absolutely beautiful game...
Some people relax by listening to ASMR, some people watch videos of rugs being deep-cleaned, or overgrown lawns being mowed, drains being unclogged; all that good stuff...
And all those things are great...
But I swear: Slime Rancher 1 and Slime Rancher 2, in my opinion, are the perfect way to relax, unwind, and forget about the awful things and people out there in the world...

I've played the original Slime Rancher for years now, ever since it came out. Absolutely amazing, with enough story and gameplay to keep you going for a long, long time. It's fun, and still play it from time to time. Though, this game is much different. I get game devs can take a while on their game, making a game is very hard. As much as I love Slime Rancher, this game doesn't bring what I wanted when I bought it. The devs should take the game off sale for a while until they *actually* can make a decent update. I love the game. It's calming and you keep finding different things to do and upgrade. The new addition of slimes are adorable and the new areas are cool looking but difficult to navigate. Slime Rancher 1 & 2 are absolutely amazing games! they are fun, exciting, and relaxing. Once you start playing, you don't want to stop! This game is amazing and I have no doubt that it's gonna get even better!

It's fine. The first game was a unique casual adventure game, combining a simple ecosystem simulation with a very well designed FPS/3D platformer/collectathon-y formula. This game has good intentions to deepen the sunny vibes of the original game, but the adventure component just isn't present at the moment.

Love the new visual style, some of the new slimes are good ideas. The new map is probably the biggest shortcoming, it just doesn't flow as a cohesive whole like the old one did. Additionally, it's just still very early access. It will probably take a while before it hits 1.0, and then a few *more* years before it might really feel like its own game.

Don't even think about buying this until you've mastered the first game, and then, maybe just pick this up as a show of good faith. I'm giving it a temporary negative but I'm looking forward to watching it grow, and you should too.

The thing about this game verses the original is its less of an emotional story, its missing some of our favorite slime's and is still lacking in a lot of customization aspects its predecessor had, BUT I still believe its heading in the right direction.

The choice to have most of the movement in this game be upwards instead of flat is amazing. 
I love the new slime's designs and their quirks (Ringtails are so obnoxious but I think I would die for a Yolky)
I think the weather so far is an amazing innovation and gives the game lots of room to grow. 
If you like learning the story of your environment more than interpersonal relationships I'd recommend the story; its not finished but its message is loud and clear while very expressive. 
You are much less limited in space on your ranch this time, resources are much easier to collect (they're visible now instead of drills and apiary's) 
Also I hate to bring it up but visually its stunning, I didn't realize how much better this looked until I went back to play my old file on the original, I will say the odd movement of your arm when you are stationary too long still creeps me out but otherwise its beautiful.

I wont deny I miss a lot of the silliness and things like toys for my slime's (PLEASE BRING THEM TO THIS GAME) but I really do think it has a charm to it and I hope it continues to improve into a fully made game and story. <3

I'm so deeply disappointed with this game. I used to love Slime Rancher so much, I played every update as soon as I could, dug through all of the story from NPCs, I even used to help out in the Xbox Group thing. As this sequel is now, I just can't get back into it. There's almost nothing new, some new (relatively plain) slimes, missing old ones, no automation, no minigames, story, and nothing fun to sink your time and money on, like decorations for your ranch or echoes or such. There's no progression in the game anymore past a few hours of exploration. 

And worst of all, there's been so little visible progress on the game from Monomi, last update was a weather system with some old slimes and new music. The update before that was one big new biome that felt rather lacking in content/progression. I used to read the forums and developer accounts on twitter every day to see little hints of what's coming up in Slime Rancher 1, now it seems they're just talking about the weather update and that's it. I used to absolutely love this studio/game, but this is just so very disheartening to see. I hope they'll eventually make this game into one even bigger than the first, but for now I absolutely cannot recommend you buy it.
Edit: Game is still amazing :)

Really sad to write this, but Slime Rancher 2 needs a LOT of work. 
It feels like this game is a copy and paste of the first Slime Rancher, but the gameplay is WORSE. What was special about Slime Rancher is its novelty; everything was new and other-worldly. The slimes were unique, each section of the map had its puzzles, there were enticing upgrades to work towards, and there was a mysterious plot to unfold. 

In Slime Rancher 2, there is no novelty. You've seen most of the slimes before. The map & islands feel so underdeveloped that it's easy to get lost in the blandness of it all. It has barely any puzzles, and they are a rehash of the previous game's puzzles. There currently are no major upgrades to achieve and work towards. And there's....no plot? You just wander around in a boring environment capturing slimes you've already captured before with no goals, no challenges, and no interests. 

The gameplay is just repetitive, slow, and boring. I wish it had that 'awe' factor like its predecessor. 

I would like to say wait until the game is out of early-access, but after months the only new update we've received is a weather update....so now there's things like rain, and thunder, and sometimes tiny tornadoes. Which do not affect much of anything, just an extra sound in your ear.
Even though it's in early access (v0.3.0) there's already a lot of content, definitely worth the money.

Even tho it's only in early access atm still such a great game already, exploring the world is so enjoyable so far and I love all the locations. I loved the first game and I can't wait to see what they add to this one in the future.
It's such a comfort game to ply at mid night or when you're feeling down.

As much as I'm enjoying this game, I'm hesitant to fully recommend it just yet. I've put in 15 hours so far, and it's long since begun to get tedious. Not because of the exploration; that's wonderful. I'm truly enjoying the new areas and feel genuine awe at the dynamic weather as each new type shows up. In all this time, I've yet to see all there is to see in the worlds we've been given so far. I'm also enjoying the new mechanic for finding resources. 

No, the problem is with ranching. For a game called Slime Rancher, I was hoping the mechanics for, you know, ranching slimes would be complete. Sadly, I'm well past the point of needing drone assistance to maintain my ranch, but there's nothing of the sort in sight. As I've got quite a bit of money built up, I'm about ready to give up on my slimes and take to exploring full time. It's getting far too monotonous to continue caring for all my farm plots and slimes without drones. I can't keep it up and frankly I no longer want to. I may just set this game aside until drones are added to gameplay, because the alternative is chucking all my slimes into the sea and collecting them all over again when this basic mechanic comes back. 

TLDR; I truly adore what they've started, but I can't wait for them to add in the basic necessities that were so pivotal in the first game.
The only thing missing is achievements, even if its in game only and not on steam.

I love slime rancher 1. My wife plays it all the time. Sadly Slime Rancher 2 just doesn't hold a candle to the first. While I do get its in early access, however almost no updates for 4 to 6 months at a time. Plus nothing from developers on when things will be worked on or updated is really disappointing. They have made millions from this game and when they do provide updates they are very small adding only a couple things. At this far into the products life I expected way more. There is no story to speak of and the gadgets and items from the first game are not even in the game yet. This is something I would have expected at launch at a bare minimum you should have all the slimes and gadgets from the first game. So at this current time in the products life  I cannot recommend this product I would suggest holding off until the developers either become active or release more content.

The developers are taking too long to make updates. I only bought the game to see if any major changes were made since it released and had watched videos about it. But almost nothing has changed, in over a year. One new area, and a weather system is all that's new? No. You've gotta be kidding me. I'm sorry, but I can't recommend this, especially if they are gonna take 9 months after they made the new area(February 16th, 2023) to release a weather system (November 14th, 2023). I am wasting time even making this review. I want to refund it now. Also my computer doesn't run well on this, and the first game runs at over 100fps. The minimum requirements aren't accurate. My system has a GTX 1050 mobile(30% slower on average than GTX 960, the minimum listed GPU). I assume they are targeting 1080p resolution, lowest settings, at 30fps with the minimum requirements. Since my GPU is 30% slower than the GTX 960, the minimum required GPU according to the store page, I would expect 30-40% slower performance in this game, with 1080p lowest settings, estimated fps is about 20. Sometimes the game jumps up to 20 fps, but is usually under 15 fps most of the time. FYI, that is in 800x600 resolution, not 1920x1080(1080p). 800x600(or rather 600p) is way lower than 1080p and looks terrible. Even if they target 720p at 30fps instead of 1080p at 30fps, then still, that still would make it about 20 or less fps with a GTX 960, not 30fps. If they are targeting it at less than 30fps, then these devs are a joke. 30fps to me looks choppy and slow enough. I have to force my computer to a custom resolution(480X360!) which would force the game to run at that resolution, and then i can get 40fps, tops. But that is a resolution the game doesn't normally allow. I shouldn't have to force my computer to run at such a low resolution just to play this game. I've done a few things to try and fix this, but everything I've tried so far doesn't work. I'm not forcing my computer to an old junk tv resolution just to play this game. When purchasing I was fully aware my system was a bit under the minimum requirements. But i was expecting 20fps, at either 1080p or 720p, which I have not gotten. It's almost as if they have put something in the game that makes it run terribly if your computer is under the minimum requirements. 

One last thing I must mention is how they want us to give them the "Labor of Love" steam award, and they were only even able to do it because the game was over a year old. But steam does give info about steam awards, and this particular award's description is: "This game has been out for a while. The team is well past the debut of their creative baby, but being the good parents they are, these devs continue to nurture and support their creation. This game, to this day, is still getting new content after all these years." At the end, it specifically states "after all these years", meaning a good 3 or more years but any game that is over a year old is eligible to be nominated. I can't believe these devs tried to convince is to nominate their game, when it is still in early access, and barely any content has been added from release to now. Based off of this, I just can't recommend this game. I will be refunding this, and I'll specifically mention in the note of my refund about how these performance issues don't make sense. Feel free to get as mad as you want, fans. I've allowed comments. But I am not changing my opinion. It'll be 2025 before this game can come out of early access.

For an early access game, it's pretty stable. I have noticed that playing for long periods of time audio starts messing up, and certain sound effects are either delayed or don't play at all, but those are just minor bugs. I loved the original slime rancher, and new I had to play the sequel. I'm not saying the games a bad game, but I feel they could have done better with this. Slime rancher 2 just feels more like it should have been a DLC rather than its own game. I feel they tried doing what Subnautica Below Zero had done in development. It started out as DLC, but got too large that it had to become it's own game. The only difference is I feel Subnautica Below Zero pulls this off better than Slime Rancher 2 does. It feels a little rushed. The slimes are mostly from the original, minus around the 5 new ones. Like I said, I don't hate the game, I just feel it could of gone a different direction. Anyways, these are just my thoughts. Don't let my words sway your reasoning for purchase.

I'm writing this review based on my experience with version 0.3.0, having explored most of the slimes. The environments are better than the first game, the graphics are better than the first game, almost everything is (except no "ending" yet ;-;). Seems to be on its way to being possibly my favorite game so far!

Currently my only gripe in the game is that finding/farming resources is incredibly time consuming I hope to see the machines like the drill and pump from the first game here, where instead you place it on the top of the deposits/resources and it auto harvests it and you just pick it up when you visit it. Doesn't have to be at the start but maybe something for "end game" or mid way through.

I really like the aspects of weather and I am hoping for more different types of weather and slimes that result from the weather. Honestly, I'm unsure if it's my luck but I didn't find the weather slimes to be incredibly rare; maybe like 5 slimes per weather event. Possibly maybe a missed patch note, because the people of Reddit seem to highly disagree.

Also I don't mind the wait time for each update, as they all seem to come out finished and polished. I just hope that the game is finished sometime around 2025, maybe early 2026.

TLDR: Game is awesome so far, only gripe being resource farming, hope for more in future updates!

What is there to say? Slime Rancher 2 is more of the amazing game that was Slime Rancher - but with plenty of new and updated stuff to make it its own great game. Just like the first game it is such a charming and relaxing little adventure on an alien world just waiting to be explored with ranch to be managed. 

=== === === === ===
First - new slimes. We got some returning slimes, including (but not limited to) Pink, Tabby, Phosphor, Rock and Boom. We also got quite a few new ones such as Cotton (rabbit slime), Bat and Angler to name a few. Not to mention with new graphics slimes look even blobbier and bouncier!
=== === === === ===
Second - new ranch. While I personally overall liked the OG ranch more, Rainbow Islands' Observatory is still very charming (I kinda like the look more) and has plenty to offer with 4 subsections outside of main area. Alongside new ranch it is worth to mention new biomes - Rainbow Fields, Ember Valley, Starlight Strand and hidden Powderfall Bluffs, each wonderfully unique and ready to be explored. For example Rainbow Valley is a place to learn the drills of the game and capture some easy-to-handle Slimes for your new ranch.
=== === === === ===
Third - changes, cause yeah there is bunch. First I would like to mention change to slime science resources gathering. Gone are pumps, drills and apiaries - now you gotta collect resources from biomes which they are characteristic for. For example Deep Brine and Jellystone can be found around Rainbow Fields. I personally find it more immersive then og gathering but it can be a bit more time sinking compared to OG solution. I would also like to mention that drones have to yet be added, so all the ranch duties are for player to be done. 
With last update Weather is a thing happening accross the Isles so that is very neat. 
=== === === === ===

So yeah, great sequel to a great game and with devs still working on new updates, there is plenty of content to look forward to.

Really a mixed experience --- I had to deliberate on whether to recommend the game or not. It's still fun and it is very similar in terms of gameplay to the original. However, because it's still early access, the mechanics feel substantially less fleshed out, resulting in a far greater balance of farming time to adventure time compared to SR1. Extremely important mechanics from SR1 that made developing the ranch easier like resource extractors, drones, and two-way teleports are missing. The distance between the ranch expansions has been expanded, too, so you can expect to spend 10 minutes to every hour trucking 30 plorts at a time back and forth across unnecessarily long pathways to get from the ranch expansions to the refinery/plort market as you try desperately to scavenge enough crafting resources to increase your stack size and/or build market/refinery links. Also, the cutest slime in the game only eats food that you have to manually gather piece by piece at a specific time of night in one specific location because you can't farm it --- really??? 

On the plus side, the ambience and graphics have improved. The environments are prettier than the original game and the music is even better than it was in the original. The increased focus on weather mechanics is fun and makes the game world feel more like a location. Effects and textures have been refined --- phosphor slimes never looked this good. The game world is not as large as SR1, but there's still plenty of space to explore (it feels about the size of the original mainland, before the Glass Desert and later expansions). 

It seems like this is the start of an excellent game that will rival, if not outclass, the original in a few years, once the kinks (particularly the lack of bee drones) have been worked out. Right now, whether it's worth the price really depends on whether you preferred the farming or the adventure mechanics in the original. If you'd like a greater balance of farming time, then it may be worth it. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend buying it for the list price yet, but maybe eventually.

This is an exploration and story game, disguised as a farming game.  The economy will break if you try to min-max it, so maybe don't use Largo slimes and it would be better? idk

The balance is all off.  It took me 14 days in-game and 4 hours real-time for money to become meaningless.  All the upgrades that make the gameplay more enjoyable are locked behind items you find scattered throughout the map in small quantities (the gameplay of moving through the world, exploring, and collecting, specifically).  This means you need to spend vastly more time out and about than tending to your slimes.  I ended up in a position where I essentially had to let my slimes "starve" to progress the game.  This isn't exactly an issue, the slimes don't die, but it feels weird.  I would have had to spend an inordinate amount of time pumping out food and prepping all the feeders to support the slimes for the multiple days I'd be gone, and why would I do that when I don't even need their plorts for money anymore?

Additionally, they give you all these cool devices and tech you _could_ place all around the map, but no you can't because those also need the same exploration items you find in twos and threes in a few places on the map each day.  I could have literal hundreds of any given plort, tens of thousands of dollars, but I don't have enough of the other items to utilize what they put in the game.

It's a fun game--I'm enjoying it and I think those with a calmer play style would enjoy it, but it feels off.  Like I said in the beginning, the farming and exploring aspects are not well balanced.  The "difficulty" curve is nearly a straight line up, except the difficulty is unlocking the sweet new shoes they showed you from day one, or the ability to sprint a little further, or hold more things so you can explore longer before having to return or find a place to store them.

Love this game with every fiber of my being, however even after a year since release there hasn't been much to do. I understand the game is still early access with a no-rush dev team so the game can be made better, but some sort of automation that we got in slime rancher 1 would be nice, instead of traveling across lots of land to collect plorts and feed slimes.

I know this game is still early access, but so far, compared to the first game, this game is objectively worse in most aspects. I've had issues with snares not working, like at all. There is a single slime that is basically impossible to find, and also isn't even needed for upgrades and becomes useless money wise by the point when if you find it, which is infuriating for a completionist, leaving the game open for hours for it never to spawn. There's no drones in this game like there was in the first one, meaning you have to manage your slimes entirely on your own, piling up quickly even when you're away for short bursts unless you purposely minimize your corrals efficiency, and there's no extra mini games or added content like how first game had with the Nimble Valley. 

This game is more or less the same, just new areas to explore, all the other functionality is the same, so with that in mind, this game feels like somewhat of a downgrade with the lack of aforementioned problems above. The only things I can say this game gets right is that you have the refinery lab right from the get go, and instead of needing to drill in specifically set locations for special resources, they spawn all over the place and can be vacuumed up with the vac gun, which is a much better approach to that aspect in my opinion. That and there's also new weather effects which can cause some fun things to happen and make exploration a little more fun.

Overall it's still a fun game, but I think unless they fix the aforementioned issues I have with it, I don't think I can rank it as good as the first game. Still, if you liked the first game, or didn't play the first game and wanted to skip straight to this one, it still might be worth a try.

6/10

 It's Slime Rancher but with better graphics and some new minor mechanics.
It really doesn't add much to the formula, and one of the thing that it adds isn't very good (resources).

 One would expect the sequel of the game to add more freedom, more experimentation or something that would add to the gameplay, but as of today, it is almost as vanilla as it can be.

 It may be a plus for some people, but for me it's more of a downer than anything, still it is an enjoyable game.

 And adding on the materials thing, it is wrongly implemented, you just go farming predetermined spots of resources like its Runescape for minor changes on your equipment, and not even for something that we haven't experienced in the previous game, so the reward feeling is minimal. But worst even, is that if you focus on upgrading something of your equipment, but you can't find the resources because you already farmed them, you just have to wait until they respawn and that, added to the before mentioned, makes the whole mechanic not so enjoyable.

 I would've loved something more sandbox oriented, a lot more of freedom, maybe even having to manually build the ranch, that's one of the ways I can see the gameplay loop not becoming so repetitive.
 Or something more RPG, having slime bosses to unlock new areas, and equipment.
 Even something metroidvania like, having more platforming and puzzles, and unlocking specific equipment to being able to pass those challenges by crafting it with slime rare drops that you get if your slimes are very happy.

Also an extra that could be easily fixed, is that gold becomes too abundant and you get no use for it because you full upgrade your ranch super fast. In this type of games usually the resource management of things and grinding hard but rewarding updates for the base is usually a core gameplay mechanic.

 Still, it's on early access, it has been 14 of the 18 months they estimated for 1.0, the game isn't bad, and still has content to come, for that reason I give it a good review. Personally I feel this game as a "Meh".

It's early access so there's more to make but as of now it just felt like I was playing the previous Slime Rancher with better graphics, new island, more slimes, more tool upgrades, but lacking everything else. Some features (farms, cages etc.) are just an exact copy from the first with nothing new while other features that were good from the first game were taken out.

For example, there's really no puzzles or progression in the map anymore. I was excited to open doors just to realize they were tunnels leading me back to places in the map I've already been to. Some Gordos I'd pop just to unlock geysers to places I'd already been to because of the jet pack. 

Honestly wish they had added multiplayer to the sequel. It would have been more fun collecting with a friend since it felt like that's all was there. Giving this a thumbs down because the cute slimes can only sway me so much but if you are a die hard Slime Rancher fan maybe none of this will matter and you'll love it.

The game itself is in its infancy right now, and it'll probably take ages to finish, but I'm fine with that as long as the game is solid. I absolutely adored Slime Rancher 1 and have no doubt given the time that this game will turn out to be a great sequel.

So far I'm not a fan This is almost identical to SR1 gameplay -- I'm sort of confused as to what the point of this sequel is. Just like SR1, you have plots to buy crops/fields/chicken-coop/slime-enclosure, there are no new field types. All the upgrades are identical too. Just like SR1, you have to spend money to unlock areas to get plots, and you need to craft teleporters to get around, just like SR1. You run around outside your farm to collect slimes, which exhibit the exact same behavior as SR1, and you collect resources like fruits/vegetables/chickens just like SR1. You sell plorts through some tube-vacuum thing which gives you money depending on the current price, which fluctuates each day. It's all the same.

The exploration part of SR1 was not the best, and there are no new exploration or movement mechanics here. It's not like you're bunny/strafe-jumping through the map, or spinning through the map like sonic, or wahooing all around like mario, etc. I'm not saying they need to add crazy mechanics, it's just tiring to see the second iteration of this game have the same 'generic 3D platformer' controls (hold W and shift to sprint when you have the energy), especially when it feels so floaty and disconnected from the world. This might seem like a weird criticism, but platforming is a large part of the game, & I just find it really boring and uninspired the second time around. I have no motivation to explore.

That would have been fine for me though, since I was most hopeful to have an automated approach to slime farming. This doesn't seem to be the case. There's a lot of manual work involved each day, mostly running back and forth constantly fighting the limited inventory. This was fine for SR1, but doing the same thing in a sequel is just not fun. I don't know why you can't automate the resources transit, or do anything -- why must I do all this myself? I understand they're trying to go for a relaxing atmosphere here, like doing repetitive things in Animal Crossing or Stardew Valley can be relaxing, but with those games you are doing a whole array of different daily tasks. Here, your daily tasks are just to run back and forth, and that's it.

I understand it's early access but rarely will you see a game change its core design principles once it hits this point. It seems they probably discussed their design goals for this game, and they decided to mimic SR1 rather than to expand or change what they had already done. The exploration and the farm are both identical to SR1. It's unlikely that they will add some sort of automation to be accessible from early-mid game that introduces a ton of additional mechanics. If it's just something I purchase and everything is handled for me, that isn't a fun solution & would still feel like SR1 but with less busywork. So I have a feeling that it's something that had to be added early during development. But we'll see what they have in store.

Also, the rendering performance is poor, often tanking framerate when there are many slimes nearby. Perhaps it's just my machine or configuration, I haven't ran a renderdoc/nsight frame analysis and don't really feel up to it right now.

I'm going to keep checked in to see what updates they have down the pipeline, but right now I'd only play this if you haven't played SR1.

The very first 6 notes you hear when you start up the game always put such a giant goofy smile on my face. They have since I first launched this game after buying it, I get all smiley and giddy.
I smile because I know what's coming, I know I'm about to be surrounded by silly little wiggly guys of all shapes, colors and sizes. I smile because I know, waiting for me, are little slimes who love me just as much as I love them. I smile because I have these little goopy babies that I get to care for and adore. 
Sometimes when I'm playing, I'll go a while without doing anything productive. I'll just stare at a corral of slimes, or walk around my ranch and watch them bounce around. I'll even pause for a bit when I go out into the wild, and just watch them play and have fun.
Today I saw two honey slimes chasing each other down an incline in Starlight Strand, and then they each got distracted by something halfway down. One was curious about some food, the other stared in awe at a flutter slime. I can't blame it, flutter slimes are very pretty.
I have Tarrs off because this is a game I much prefer to relax with, and Tarrs are stressful, so the slimes have nothing to fear in my save. Their life is so carefree. I wish I was one of these funny little guys.

I was so excited for the game and bought it on release day, which I NEVER do. My whole family has 100's of hours in the first one. This one has less content than the first game, and brings nothing new of substance to the table. The map is boring and confusing, with less detail than almost any other game I can think of DESPITE needing a beefy computer to run it. The lighting is nice, but there are no assets or models that really define one area from the next. It desperately needs a starfish on the beach, or a cactus in the desert. Literally barren textureless landscapes await you. You'll spend WAY more than half your time asking "am i even in the right area, or am I lost again". I'm not even a player that gets turned around on games, but this one has such a confusing layout and visual blandness that you'll do the same. The in game map isn't very good at all either, so it won't be much help.

The actual slime ranching is bugged in quite a few ways. In the first game chickens were always a bottleneck. In this game they breed out of control in your basement and it takes HOURS to clean them all out if your computer doesn't crawl to a halt first (edit: i think they fixed this one, but there's a plethora of other bugs).

I figured the success of the first game, despite it being a simple game, would cause the developers to start working on a superior version with their newfound wealth. I imagined breeding slime hybrids on a generational scale to achieve new breeds, and imagined customization of pens that were freeform and fillable with assets, but instead we got "hit x to upgrade". Drones are missing, clipping errors happen, unfinished areas abound, the jetpack isn't fun to fly and takes forever to recharge (you'll be standing on top of trees waiting for a recharge WAY too often), upgrades don't go as far as the OG game, every update just adds some decorative rock or grass that's already found in the wild for you to replicate at home base for I guess playing dollhouse..... I could just keep going.

I hope they get some John Carmack level developers and visionaries into their studio soon and pay them some grind hours, otherwise I don't think they have the talents to polish whatever this thing currently is. I beat it to %100 completion and still feel this strongly. I was secretly hoping they were just going to unlock the fun part with progress. Imagine my surprise when the credits rolled and the fun part never started.

as a huge slime rancher fan who has been playing since 2016, you should not buy this game right now. it is just the first game with cutesier graphics and less content. sure it's in early access but it's not very clear as of now what direction the game will go. will it be like the first game's early access and add new systems/mechanics or will it just add new slimes and areas (which is what the first game has been doing for 5 years, so why create a sequel)? from the looks of things right now, that's not very clear.

"How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?
“The full version of Slime Rancher 2 will feature more slimes to wrangle, resources to collect, gadgets to build, places to explore, completion of its story, and more. As we develop Slime Rancher 2 we also plan to introduce features that change up the Slime Rancher formula while still retaining the experience that millions of players already have enjoyed.

Slime Rancher 2 is where the world of Slime Rancher will grow and evolve for years to come.”"

>what did they mean by this bros

if new stuff that actually improves the game mechanically and new systems are added i'll change this review, but right now the only different thing mechanically is the resource collection revamp, which i found to be more annoying and time consuming than in the first game where you just put drills and sleep. i'm worried the game won't do anything new and just add more slimes and places to explore, which could have just been dlc for the first game (and we wouldn't lose our worlds we spent dozens, if not hundreds of hours in)

edit: so it's been a year. the only new slimes were 3 of the old ones being ported back and 1 new very rare one. yes, we still don't have quantums, rads, and mosaics. there was one new area added, which is cool, but not really enough, and the disconnected map is starting to hurt the game more as new areas are added. the weather system is great, but i don't like that getting the 2 "new" slimes added are basically reliant on rng now. all of this could have very easily been dlc for the first game. the devs promised some new game changing mechanics in the next update centered around gadgets, we'll see how it turns out. you should just buy the first game.

Original review:
I absolutely love this game! I also fully understand this is an early access game and therefore is not yet complete. However, in its current state I wouldn´t wanna play it yet. I remember reading somewhere that the updates will come every 3 months for approximately 18 months before the full release. Ive played about 6 hours and have already lost motivation. Theres no story yet, not all slimes are there. You can only farm ten or so different slimes. There aren´t many upgrades either. And they mostly centre around inventory management. Theres no drones. The game is GORGEOUS though! I don´t have any trouble running it on my laptop on the highest settings. Conclusion: is a super promising game but I would recommend waiting for the full release if you worry about not getting bored quickly. I'm very excited for the next update too. Ill definitely change my review once more content and more optimization is added. Hope you have a lovely day :)

Let me get one thing clear right now. I am only saying I would not recommend this right now. This game is still very much in early access, plain and simple. When it's done, I truly believe it will 100% be worth it, but right now there are only signs of something great. The graphics are outstanding and the new areas feel more exploratory in nature. The new slimes are a welcome addition, though I wish more returned (though if the dervish and tangle slimes are any indication, this may be in the cards for later updates). My biggest complaint is seemingly the lack of optimization, or very poor quality of it. I am unable to maintain consistent fps with this game, with nothing else open, unless I play at the lowest settings. I play on a laptop, but it is a pretty good one, and should be able to run a game like this without issue. Instead, I get permanent frame drops that make the game run far slower. I believe this is part of being in early access, and will likely be fixed when the game comes out in full. There is so much here. The new slimes are, as I said, a welcome addition. The old faces returning are a good thing. The new environments feel so well realized.
Additionally, my only other complaint is the 'power wall'. Once broken through with a few mass plort sales, you are essentially set up for the rest of the game, and can afford anything you want. Once again, I feel like this is an issue with the game being early access, more stuff should be added in time.
Overall, it is unfinished as all hell, but shows potential of a good game. If you wanna take the plunge now I won't stop you, but I will at least say to keep this one on your wishlists. Do I recommend it now? Probably not, though I won't stop you. Will I recommend it when it's out of early access? Most likely. It's gonna be amazing when it's finished, whenever that comes. Thank you Monami, can't wait to see the final product.
